[Link to talk](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gg-lEJ4sBaA&t=1475s)

Databricks Delta seeks to unite the advantages of traditional data lakes with those of data warehouses - massive scale and open source-friendly, but with reliable performance for both massive scans as well as point look-ups.
Databricks Delta was built as direct response to what Databricks pitched as the “failure of lambda” - they wanted to avoid this story:
It seems like Delta is mostly just a UI and some optimizations on top of [Apache Tajo](http://tajo.apache.org/)...

Delta is:
  • Transactional - Spark jobs that impact your underlying data warehouse are ACID-compliant
  • Schematized and validated - bad records are actually rejected / marked for handling and reprocessing
  • Reactive - both for analytics (a transaction is committed = graph analytics update!) and for scale
